title: Lakeside Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Peter Facey / Amphitheatre in Lakeside Country Park
images.caption: Amphitheatre in Lakeside Country Park. This is a large, flat circular area surrounded by banks. There is a smaller circular area to its southwest (perhaps intended as a collecting ring for events in the main one) and this picture is looking across that smaller area with the main area beyond.

images.title: Rob Candlish / Eastleigh Lakeside Railway
images.caption: Eastleigh Lakeside Railway, near to Southampton International Airport. 10 inch gauge Britannia Pacific 70055 "Rob Roy" arriving at Eastleigh Parkway station on the Eastleigh Lakeside Railway in Lakeside Country Park, Wide Lane, Eastleigh. The line is dual gauge so that both 10 inch and 7 inch gauge locomotives can be used. This makes the pointwork complicated though.

images.title: Kevin Legg / Lakeside Railway North Stop.
images.caption: Lakeside Railway North Stop. The farthest stop on the Eastleigh Lakeside small railway. There are picnic tables for the use of passengers so they can have a break during their ride.

images.title: Peter Facey, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beach Lake. This is one of three lakes close together. Fishing is available in the other two.

description: Enjoy 60 acres of lakes, wet meadow and woodland located between Eastleigh and Southampton. The park has a range of birds, insects and small mammals as well as the occasional fox and deer. There is also a miniature railway and a cafe. You can reach the park from Southampton, Eastleigh or Winchester using National Cycle Route 23 which runs through the park. See the Southampton to Winchester Cycle Route. Just to the east of the park you can enjoy more cycling and walking trails in Itchen Valley Country Park. You can also pick up the Itchen Way here and enjoy a riverside walk towards Southampton or Winchester.
